intro: Cerastium szalaberense, commonly known as the Szaláber's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically rounded and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Cerastium szalaberense is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
